name: list-item-layout
description: A List Item Layout represents layout used for list view item elements.

slots.description: The default slot accepts the primary data to be displayed.

overline.description: The overline slot is for adding a overline text above the default slot.

selector.description: The selector slot can accept a oj-selector component and is optional.

leading.description: The leading slot is used for adding a leading visual next to the selector.

secondary.description: The secondary slot is for adding a secondary text below the default text.

tertiary.description: The tertiary slot is for adding a tertiary text below the secondary text.

metadata.description: The metadata for adding extra trailing information. Examples of metadata are author, date etc.

trailing.description: The trailing slot is used for adding a trailing visual.

action.description: Action slot often uses a toolbar. In general, the action slot should display either one primary action or one or more secondary actions.

quaternary.description: The quaternary slot is for adding a quaternary text below the tertiary text.

navigation.description: The navigation slot is used for adding links below the trailing slot.

inset.description: Controls padding around outside of list item layouts.

verticalAlignment.description: Default is 'middle' which vertically aligns layout content to center of the row.

setProperty.description: Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component of the change, triggering a corresponding event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

getProperty.description: Retrieves the value of a property or a subproperty.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

setProperties.description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.
